intro: Lithocardium angiocarpum, commonly known as the rock apple, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and small, fleshy berries. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The fruit is edible and has been used traditionally for food and medicinal purposes.
